docs.lead_paragraph: Pope Francis will meet with homeless people, immigrants and prisoners during his upcoming trip to Cuba and the United States and become the first pope to address the U.S. Congress. He'll also preside over a meeting about religious liberty — a major issue for U.S. bishops in the wake of the Supreme Court's gay marriage decision.

headline.main: Pope to Meet With Homeless, Prisoners and Immigrants in US
headline.print_headline: Pope to Meet With Homeless, Prisoners and Immigrants in US

docs.lead_paragraph: The world’s top banks and insurers are seeing their business models challenged by “fintech” start-ups, which are reshaping what consumers and businesses expect from financial services, industry insiders and experts say.

headline.main: Fintech Explosion Puts Banks in Digital Firing Line
headline.print_headline: Fintech Explosion Puts Banks in Digital Firing Line

docs.lead_paragraph: For more than a decade, he was the self-styled Indiana Jones of Egypt, presiding over its antiquities and striding through temples and tombs as the star of TV documentaries that made him an international celebrity.

docs.lead_paragraph: An order bars the Obama administration from enforcing the rules against some religious groups until the Supreme Court decides whether to hear an appeal.

headline.main: Court Lets Some Charities Avoid Rules on Birth Control Coverage
headline.print_headline: Court Lets Some Charities Avoid Rules on Birth Control Coverage

docs.abstract: Supreme Court issues order allowing certain nonprofit religious groups to avoid compliance with federal requirements under health care reform law concerning insurance coverage of contraceptives for women until justices decide whether to hear appeal.
docs.snippet: An order bars the Obama administration from enforcing the rules against some religious groups until the Supreme Court decides whether to hear an appeal.

docs.lead_paragraph: The country finally has an opportunity to change the subject on health care, after the Supreme Court again upheld President Barack Obama's law.

headline.main: High Court Ruling Offers Chance to Alter Health Law Debate
headline.print_headline: High Court Ruling Offers Chance to Alter Health Law Debate

docs.lead_paragraph: With same-sex marriage now a right, some companies are likely to deliver what feels like an ultimatum: Marry within a certain time frame, or lose your partner’s health care coverage.

headline.main: Fate of Domestic Partner Benefits in Question After Marriage Ruling
headline.print_headline: With Marriage a Right, Domestic Partner Benefits Come Into Question

docs.abstract: National right for same-sex marriage raises question about  domestic partner benefits; some companies are expected to tell employees they must marry within certain time frame, or lose partner's health coverage.
docs.snippet: With same-sex marriage now a right, some companies are likely to deliver what feels like an ultimatum: Marry within a certain time frame, or lose your partner’s health care coverage.
